line_1: Sit on her nest within the hawthorn bush,

line_1: Trills in each tree, and dies in every bush.

line_2: Pomona o'er the hedgerow spreads her blush,

line_1: Here let me stop beneath this spreading bush,
line_2: And listen to the sweet thick-warbling thrush,

line_2: And there with tempting step all heedless brush

line_2: Little Riot has fastened her Teeth in his brush,

line_1: The embrios that on every bush
line_2: 'Midst the wild notes of songsters blush;

line_1: And hail-storms rattle through the budding bush;
line_2: Yet frosts succeed, and winds impetuous rush,

line_1: They fly for Shelter to the thickest Bush;
line_2: There silent sit, and All at once is hush.
